TopicTitle: Adjective forms of Kerbal celestial bodies

Articles.Content:
I'd like to collect a list of the adjective forms people use for the various bodies in the game.

Some are pretty common, I think, like Munar for Mun, but what interesting ones do you use?

Some of mine are:

Kerbol - Kerbolar

Kerbin - Kerbal/Kerbin

Mun - Munar

Minmus - Minmusian

I haven't been much beyond the Kerbin system, so I haven't really given much thought to others (yet).

From the guy who made the planets:

Original Name: New Name, Adjective

LavaPlanet: Moho, Mohonan or Mohonian

CloudyPlanet: Eve, Evotian

Gilly: still Gilly, Gillian

DesertPlanet: Duna, Dunan or Dunian

DesertPlanetMoon: Ike, Iketian

GasPlanet1: Jool, Joovan

OceanMoon: Laythe, Laytherian

IceMoon: Vall, Vallestrial

RockyMoon: Tylo, Tylosan

Bop: still Bop, Bopian
The only ones I seem to end up mentally using are Munar, Dunar, and Joolian. And, slightly tongue-in-cheek, Eeloosive.

Personally, particularly with regards to return missions, I am a fan of "Evil" for Eve.

For serious adjectives:

Kerbol: Kerbolar

Minmus: maybe Minmal?

Duna: Dunar

Jool: Joolian

Minmus: maybe Minmal?

I like it

And 'Evil' for Eve, too.

Why does Dres always get left out, poor rejected little planet.

Dres - Dresian

Why does Dres always get left out, poor rejected little planet.

Dres - Dresian

Let's take a stand against Dres prejudice! Dres is a planet too!!!!

I use Munar and Joolian often, Dunar slightly less so. I haven't really thought about or used adjectives for other planets or moons.

Let's take a stand against Dres prejudice! Dres is a planet too!!!!

I would join such a Dres Appreciation Society immediately.
As I understand it, the star in the system is simply the Sun, so the adjective would be "solar", just like IRL. At least that was true two versions ago. Have the devs officially renamed it?
When I stranded Jeb on Moho, I called him The Last of the Mohocans.

I use Munar and Joolian often, Dunar slightly less so. I haven't really thought about or used adjectives for other planets or moons.

I would join such a Dres Appreciation Society immediately.

This can be our logo:

....Or maybe not...

O Dres, why art thou so ignored?

RockyMoon: Tylo, Tylosan

That sounds an awkward lot like someone referring to Tylo using a japanese honorofic... Or maybe like someone (stereotypily-)animizing KSP's planets

Also, some new ones:

Kerbin: still Kerbin, Kerbinan or Kerban

Mun: still Mun, Munar or Munian

Minmus: still Minmus, Minmusian or Minmusal

...And, slightly tongue-in-cheek, Eeloosive.

Totally dig that. I would add:

Bopudlian

Polish

Valiant

Laythely

Ikic

My own terms are generally:

Mohovian

Evian

Gillish

Kerbin

Munar

Minmal

Dunan

Ikish

Dresian

Joolific

Laythocentric

Tyloptic

Vallian

Boppish

Pollen

Eeloosive

Generally quite silly, in short.

As I understand it, the star in the system is simply the Sun, so the adjective would be "solar", just like IRL. At least that was true two versions ago. Have the devs officially renamed it?

Well, solar is from Sol (not the Sun) as Lunar is from Luna.

Kerbin's sun is Kerbol.

so that Kerbolar? Kerbolic? ("... in Kerbolic orbit.." ) sounds OK

EDIT personally use perigee and apogee, and solar, lunar etc. works for me

Edited November 10, 2014 by Brainlord Mesomorph

As I understand it, the star in the system is simply the Sun, so the adjective would be "solar", just like IRL. At least that was true two versions ago. Have the devs officially renamed it?
Well, solar is from Sol (not the Sun) as Lunar is from Luna.

Kerbin's sun is Kerbol.

so that Kerbolar? Kerbolic? ("... in Kerbolic orbit.." ) sounds OK

EDIT personally use perigee and apogee, and solar, lunar etc. works for me

Barefoot Friar is correct. The official, in-game name is the Sun. Kerbol is a popular name given by the community.

So strictly, the adjective should indeed be Solar, (from Sol, Latin for Sun) as there is AFAIK, no other adjective form for the English word Sun.

Personally I still like Kerbolar, and just assume that Kerbol is the word for Sun in some ancient Kerbal language analogous to Latin on Earth.
I like the plural for minmus to be Minmanite.
